title:
Chiral Quantum-Optical Elements for Waveguide-QED with Sub-wavelength
  Rydberg-Atom Arrays
authors: Lida Zhang, Fan Yang, Klaus M{\o}lmer, Thomas Pohl
abstract:
We describe an approach to achieve near-perfect unidirectional light-matter
coupling to an effective quantum emitter that is formed by a subwavelength
array of atoms in the Rydberg-blockade regime. The nonlinear reflection and
transmission of such two-dimensional superatoms are exploited in different
interferometric setups for the deterministic generation of tunable single
photons and entangling two-photon operations with high fidelities,
$\mathcal{F}\gtrsim0.999$. The described setup can function as a versatile
nonlinear optical element in a free-space photonic quantum network with simple
linear elements and without the need of additional mode confinement, optical
resonators, or optical isolators.
